verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that this word came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: During the 4th year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah's reign over Judah, the LORD spoke this message to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the words that I have spoken unto thee against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the days of Josiah, even unto this day.
verses.web: “Take a scroll of a book, and write in it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah, even to this day.
verses.ct: "Get a scroll and write down everything I've told you — every word I've spoken against Israel, against Judah, and against all the nations, from the very first time I spoke to you back in the days of Josiah right up to today.

verses.kjv: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I purpose to do unto them; that they may return every man from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.
verses.web: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I intend to do to them; that they may each return from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
verses.ct: Maybe when the people of Judah hear about all the disaster I'm planning to bring on them, each one of them will turn away from their evil ways. Then I can forgive their sin and wrongdoing."

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah: and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the LORD, which he had spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.
verses.web: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all LORD’s words, which he had spoken to him, on a scroll of a book.
verses.ct: So Jeremiah called for Baruch son of Neriah. As Jeremiah dictated every word the LORD had spoken to him, Baruch wrote it all down on a scroll.

verses.kjv: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the LORD:
verses.web: Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am restricted. I can’t go into LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Then Jeremiah gave Baruch these instructions: "I'm restricted and can't go to the LORD's temple myself.

verses.kjv: Therefore go thou, and read in the roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the words of the LORD in the ears of the people in the LORD’s house upon the fasting day: and also thou shalt read them in the ears of all Judah that come out of their cities.
verses.web: Therefore you go, and read from the scroll which you have written from my mouth, LORD’s words, in the ears of the people in LORD’s house on the fast day. Also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.
verses.ct: So you need to go instead. On the next day of fasting, read the scroll you wrote from my dictation — the words of the LORD — out loud to all the people gathered in the LORD's temple. Read it so that everyone from the towns of Judah who has come to Jerusalem can hear it too.

verses.kjv: It may be they will present their supplication before the LORD, and will return every one from his evil way: for great is the anger and the fury that the LORD hath pronounced against this people.
verses.web: It may be they will present their supplication before LORD, and will each return from his evil way; for LORD has pronounced great anger and wrath against this people.”
verses.ct: Maybe they'll cry out to the LORD for mercy and each turn from their evil ways, because the anger and fury the LORD has declared against this people is overwhelming."

verses.kjv: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the words of the LORD in the LORD’s house.
verses.web: Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book LORD’s words in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Baruch son of Neriah did exactly what Jeremiah the prophet told him to do. He went to the LORD's temple and read the words of the LORD from the scroll.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the LORD to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem.
verses.web: Now in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem, and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before LORD.
verses.ct: In the 9th month of the 5th year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah's reign over Judah, a fast was proclaimed before the LORD for all the people in Jerusalem and everyone who had come from the towns of Judah.

verses.kjv: Then read Baruch in the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the LORD, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the higher court, at the entry of the new gate of the LORD’s house, in the ears of all the people.
verses.web: Then Baruch read the words of Jeremiah from the book in LORD’s house, in the room of Gemariah the son of Shaphan, the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the new gate of LORD’s house, in the ears of all the people.
verses.ct: Baruch read Jeremiah's words from the scroll to all the people at the LORD's temple. He stood in the room of Gemariah son of Shaphan the scribe, which was in the upper courtyard near the entrance of the New Gate of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the words of the LORD,
verses.web: When Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all LORD’s words,
verses.ct: When Micaiah son of Gemariah and grandson of Shaphan heard all the words of the LORD read from the scroll,

verses.kjv: Then he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s chamber: and, lo, all the princes sat there, even Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
verses.web: he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s room: and behold, all the princes were sitting there, Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
verses.ct: he went down to the royal palace, to the scribe's room. All the officials were sitting there: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.

verses.kjv: Then Michaiah declared unto them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
verses.web: Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
verses.ct: Micaiah reported to them everything he had heard Baruch read from the scroll to the people.

verses.kjv: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, unto Baruch, saying, Take in thine hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
verses.web: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll in which you have read in the ears of the people, and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand, and came to them.
verses.ct: So all the officials sent Jehudi son of Nethaniah, son of Shelemiah, son of Cushi, to Baruch with this message: "Bring the scroll you read to the people and come here." Baruch son of Neriah picked up the scroll and went to them.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.
verses.web: They said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.
verses.ct: "Please sit down and read it to us," they said. So Baruch read it aloud to them.

verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they were afraid both one and other, and said unto Baruch, We will surely tell the king of all these words.
verses.web: Now when they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one toward another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”
verses.ct: When they heard all the words, they looked at each other in alarm. Then they said to Baruch, "We have to report all of this to the king."

verses.kjv: And they asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?
verses.web: They asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words at his mouth?”
verses.ct: They asked Baruch, "Tell us — how exactly did you write all this? Did Jeremiah dictate it to you?"

verses.kjv: Then Baruch answered them, He pronounced all these words unto me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.
verses.web: Then Baruch answered them, “He dictated all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”
verses.ct: "Yes," Baruch answered. "He spoke every word to me himself, and I wrote it down in ink on the scroll."

verses.kjv: Then said the princes unto Baruch, Go, hide thee, thou and Jeremiah; and let no man know where ye be.
verses.web: Then the princes said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah go hide. Don’t let anyone know where you are.”
verses.ct: Then the officials told Baruch, "You and Jeremiah need to go into hiding right now. Don't let anyone know where you are."

verses.kjv: And they went in to the king into the court, but they laid up the roll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the ears of the king.
verses.web: They went in to the king into the court; but they had laid up the scroll in the room of Elishama the scribe. Then they told all the words in the hearing of the king.
verses.ct: They stored the scroll in the room of Elishama the scribe, then went to the king in the courtyard and reported everything to him.

verses.kjv: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the roll: and he took it out of Elishama the scribe’s chamber. And Jehudi read it in the ears of the king, and in the ears of all the princes which stood beside the king.
verses.web: So the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll; and he took it out of the room of Elishama the scribe. Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king, and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.
verses.ct: The king sent Jehudi to get the scroll. He retrieved it from Elishama the scribe's room, and Jehudi read it aloud to the king and all the officials standing around him.

verses.kjv: Now the king sat in the winterhouse in the ninth month: and there was a fire on the hearth burning before him.
verses.web: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month; and there was a fire in the brazier burning before him.
verses.ct: It was the 9th month, and the king was sitting in his winter quarters with a fire burning in the brazier in front of him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, he cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.
verses.web: When Jehudi had read three or four leaves, the king cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.
verses.ct: Each time Jehudi finished reading 3 or 4 columns, the king would slice them off with a scribe's knife and toss them into the fire in the brazier. He kept doing this until the entire scroll had been burned up.

verses.kjv: Yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the king, nor any of his servants that heard all these words.
verses.web: The king and his servants who heard all these words were not afraid, and didn’t tear their garments.
verses.ct: Neither the king nor any of his attendants who heard these words showed any fear or tore their clothes in grief.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the roll: but he would not hear them.
verses.web: Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.
verses.ct: Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah had begged the king not to burn the scroll, but he refused to listen to them.

verses.kjv: But the king commanded Jerahmeel the son of Hammelech, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet: but the LORD hid them.
verses.web: The king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but LORD hid them.
verses.ct: The king then ordered Jerahmeel the king's son, along with Seraiah son of Azriel and Shelemiah son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the LORD had hidden them.

verses.kjv: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to Jeremiah, after the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: After the king burned the scroll containing the words Baruch had written at Jeremiah's dictation, the LORD spoke to Jeremiah again:

verses.kjv: Take thee again another roll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah hath burned.
verses.web: “Take again another scroll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first scroll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.
verses.ct: "Get another scroll and write on it everything that was on the first scroll — the one King Jehoiakim of Judah burned.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, Thus saith the LORD; Thou hast burned this roll, saying, Why hast thou written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from thence man and beast?
verses.web: Concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, ‘LORD says: “You have burned this scroll, saying, “Why have you written therein, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will cause to cease from there man and animal?’ ” ’
verses.ct: As for King Jehoiakim of Judah, tell him this is what the LORD says: 'You burned that scroll and demanded to know why Jeremiah wrote that the king of Babylon would certainly come and destroy this land, wiping out every person and animal in it.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of Jehoiakim king of Judah; He shall have none to sit upon the throne of David: and his dead body shall be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He will have no one to sit on David’s throne. His dead body will be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD says about King Jehoiakim of Judah: None of his descendants will sit on David's throne. His dead body will be thrown out, exposed to the scorching heat by day and the freezing cold by night.

verses.kjv: And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them; but they hearkened not.
verses.web: I will punish him, his offspring, and his servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they didn’t listen.” ’ ”
verses.ct: I will punish him, his children, and his officials for their sin. I will bring down on them, on the people of Jerusalem, and on everyone in Judah every disaster I warned them about — because they refused to listen.'"

verses.kjv: Then took Jeremiah another roll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah; who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire: and there were added besides unto them many like words.
verses.web: Then took Jeremiah another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and many similar words were added to them.
verses.ct: So Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch the scribe, son of Neriah. As Jeremiah dictated, Baruch wrote down all the words from the scroll that King Jehoiakim of Judah had burned in the fire — and many additional messages like them were included as well.
